intro: Prangos latiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved prangos, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features lance-shaped, often hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Prangos latiloba is adapted to arid and rocky environments, showcasing a robust root system for water retention. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
